channel.title: Paul Diederichs - developer95
channel.description: This is my personal blogging site, I am new at blogging so bear with me :P

item.title: Separation Of Navigation And URL Architecture
item.description: What I got from what I read about Separating navigational links is that we should not overwhelm the user with too many options, instead only the most important and obvious to the workflow should be presented. In the absence of this, the user will most likely loose the interest to interact with the site.

item.title: Client Meetup
item.description: First I will be discovering a way to cohesively unite the features the client desires. Color scheme was adquired so it will help a lot in making the design.

item.title: Leu Verou
item.description:
Michailia Verou, A.K.A Lea Verou has a very technical background; she is a computer scientist, web standards geek, front-end developer. She is now a Research assistant at MIT CSAIL, and also an invited in the W3C CSS working group. Verou has written a book about advanced CSS, given 60+ talks around the globe.

She is currently writing a book about all her CSS knowledge, in a recent blog post she mentions how difficult it has been to write the book and work for MIT at the same time. She has a presence on Twitter, Facebook, Lanyrd, LinkedIn, dribbble, and definitely on Github.

Lea has recently coded her own autocomplete feature, I find it crazy and inspiring. I look forward to have the skill set to create things that can be beneficial to all web users.

item.title: Mixing Things Up
item.description:
Today I learned more about mixins and actually made and implemented one.I created a mixin for default links.The code is below.

	@mixin linkStyle{
	color:$lightBlue-color;
    &:visited{
        color:$lightBlue-color;
    }
    &:hover{
        color:$lightOrange-color;
        text-decoration:none;
    }
}
}

item.title: Working with Sass
item.description: Sass is AMAZING, I love the use of variables, it is a functionally I always thought would make styling a lot easier. I am more comfortable using Sass than using Jekyll. Therefore I am not really messing around with the content, and I donâ€™t have an idea of other things I should place in my Website.
